intro: Parmentiera macrophylla, commonly known as the giant leatherleaf, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, thick, waxy leaves and clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in dry, rocky soils. The plant is also valued for its ornamental qualities and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
